title: [debug assertion] thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: !value.has_escaping_bound_vars()'

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Using a `rustc` built from commit 0aa6751c19 with debug assertions enabled (debug=true in config.toml), I'm seeing an internal compiler error on the following input (found by [fuzz-rustc](https://github.com/dwrensha/fuzz-rustc)):

```rust
pub trait Foo {
    fn map() where Self: Sized, for<'a> &'a mut [u8] : ;
}
```

```
$ RUST_BACKTRACE=1 build/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage1/bin/rustc ~/Desktop/main.rs
error[E0601]: `main` function not found in crate `main`
 --> /home/dwrensha/Desktop/main.rs:1:1
  |
1 | / pub trait Foo {
2 | |     fn map() where Self: Sized, for<'a> &'a mut [u8] : ;
3 | | }
  | |_^ consider adding a `main` function to `/home/dwrensha/Desktop/main.rs`

thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: !value.has_escaping_bound_vars()', /home/dwrensha/src/rust/src/libstd/macros.rs:13:23
```
